title: China grants RMB 1.07 million for equipment installation at El Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium
description: In 2003, the Chinese government provided an RMB 1,070,000 grant to the Government of Djibouti for installing technical equipment in El Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium (or Stade H Gouled). According to a document from the Djibouti Ministry of Finance (source ID 70690), disbursements began in June 2003 and, as of 2005, 94% of the grant had been drawn down equal to RMB 1,003,503. The specific type of technical equipment that was installed in the stadium is unknown.   El Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium was originally constructed between 1986 and 1996 by COMPLANT with funding from the Chinese government.
staff_comments: Since the commitment year is uncertain, it is coded as 2003 for now which corresponds with the year of disbursement.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China grants RMB 1.07 million for equipment installation at El Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium

# Description
In 2003, the Chinese government provided an RMB 1,070,000 grant to the Government of Djibouti for installing technical equipment in El Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium (or Stade H Gouled). According to a document from the Djibouti Ministry of Finance (source ID 70690), disbursements began in June 2003 and, as of 2005, 94% of the grant had been drawn down equal to RMB 1,003,503. The specific type of technical equipment that was installed in the stadium is unknown.   El Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium was originally constructed between 1986 and 1996 by COMPLANT with funding from the Chinese government.
justification: Project involves equipment installation in a stadium, which is unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Stadium equipment installation, no energy-related components mentioned

title: China grants RMB 5.2 million for the Djibouti Art Institute Construction Project (Linked to #59165)
description: In 2003, the Chinese government granted RMB 5,195,707 (approximately DJF 110,800,010) to the Government of Djibouti for the construction of the Djiboutian Art Center (or National Culture and Art Training Institute or 吉布提艺术中心项目 or 吉布提国家文化艺术培训学院 or Travaux Institut Artistique or Institut Djiboutien Des Arts). According to a document from the Djibouti Ministry of Finance (source ID 70690), disbursements began in July 2003 and, as of 2005, 100% of the grant funds had been drawn down.   China Railway Construction Corporation was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The groundbreaking ceremony took place on 8 January 2003. Prime Minister of Djibouti Dileita Mohamed Dileita and President of Djibouti Ismail Omar Guelleh attended the ceremony, as well as Ambassador Guan Jindi of the Chinese Embassy in Djibouti. This project was completed but dates regarding construction completion or an opening ceremony are unknown. Djiboutian Government records state the institute was opened in 2004.  The donation of equipment for this center is captured in linked project #59165.
staff_comments: Since the commitment year is unknown, it is coded as 2003 for now since it is the same year as when disbursements began.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China grants RMB 5.2 million for the Djibouti Art Institute Construction Project (Linked to #59165)

# Description
In 2003, the Chinese government granted RMB 5,195,707 (approximately DJF 110,800,010) to the Government of Djibouti for the construction of the Djiboutian Art Center (or National Culture and Art Training Institute or 吉布提艺术中心项目 or 吉布提国家文化艺术培训学院 or Travaux Institut Artistique or Institut Djiboutien Des Arts). According to a document from the Djibouti Ministry of Finance (source ID 70690), disbursements began in July 2003 and, as of 2005, 100% of the grant funds had been drawn down.   China Railway Construction Corporation was the contractor responsible for project implementation. The groundbreaking ceremony took place on 8 January 2003. Prime Minister of Djibouti Dileita Mohamed Dileita and President of Djibouti Ismail Omar Guelleh attended the ceremony, as well as Ambassador Guan Jindi of the Chinese Embassy in Djibouti. This project was completed but dates regarding construction completion or an opening ceremony are unknown. Djiboutian Government records state the institute was opened in 2004.  The donation of equipment for this center is captured in linked project #59165.
justification: Project is focused on cultural and artistic infrastructure without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Construction of art institute, cultural and educational focus, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 132 million loan for acquisition of gantry cranes
description: In November 2003, the Chinese Government provided a loan worth RMB 132,096,618 (approximately 2.817 billion DJF) to the Government of Djibouti for the acquisition of new gantry cranes. According to a 2005 publication from the Djibouti's Ministry of Economy (p. 2), 100% of the loan was drawn down by the borrower. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. Implementation details are also unavailable.
staff_comments: The French project title is Acquisition de nouveaux portiques. The loan that supported this project is not included in the database of Chinese loan commitments that SAIS-CARI released in July 2020; however, it is included in official reporting by the Government of Djibouti.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description
In November 2003, the Chinese Government provided a loan worth RMB 132,096,618 (approximately 2.817 billion DJF) to the Government of Djibouti for the acquisition of new gantry cranes. According to a 2005 publication from the Djibouti's Ministry of Economy (p. 2), 100% of the loan was drawn down by the borrower. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. Implementation details are also unavailable.
justification: Project involves acquisition of gantry cranes for transportation/storage purposes without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Loan for acquisition of gantry cranes, no specific environmental or energy-related details provided

title: 12th medical team dispatched to General Peltier Hospital
description: On 5 June, 2003, Chinese and Djibouti government officials signed a protocol agreement dispatching the 12th Chinese medical team to General Peltier Hospital (l’Hôpital Général Peltier). The 10-member team served in Djibouti between 2003 and 2005.

title: Chinese Government funds establishment of Chinese Cultural Center in Cairo
description: On October 29, 2002, the Chinese Minister of Culture, Mr. Sun Jiazheng, formally inaugurated the Chinese Cultural Center (المركز الثقافي الصيني بالقاهرة) in Cairo within Giza Governorate. The Chinese Culture Center covers an area of 2000 square meters. Inside the main building in the Center, with one floor underground and 5 floors above, there are the multi-function hall, the exhibition hall, classrooms, language lab, library, reception room and dining hall.
staff_comments: The financial commitment amount and commitment year are unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government funds establishment of Chinese Cultural Center in Cairo

# Description
On October 29, 2002, the Chinese Minister of Culture, Mr. Sun Jiazheng, formally inaugurated the Chinese Cultural Center (المركز الثقافي الصيني بالقاهرة) in Cairo within Giza Governorate. The Chinese Culture Center covers an area of 2000 square meters. Inside the main building in the Center, with one floor underground and 5 floors above, there are the multi-function hall, the exhibition hall, classrooms, language lab, library, reception room and dining hall.
justification: Project is focused on cultural exchange and education without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Cultural center with classrooms, library, and exhibition spaces for cultural exchange purposes

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 10 million grant for provision of food aid
description: According to the Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, presidential decision No. 142 approved the expected receipt of a Chinese Government grant worth RMB 10,000,000 for the provision of beans between October 20. 2003 and March 13, 2004. A shipment of beans was scheduled, according to presidential decision No.142, to arrive in Port Said and clear customs later in 2004. However, AidData has not identified any evidence of a shipment arrival.
combined_text:
# Sector
DEVELOPMENTAL FOOD AID/FOOD SECURITY ASSISTANCE

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 10 million grant for provision of food aid

# Description
According to the Egyptian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, presidential decision No. 142 approved the expected receipt of a Chinese Government grant worth RMB 10,000,000 for the provision of beans between October 20. 2003 and March 13, 2004. A shipment of beans was scheduled, according to presidential decision No.142, to arrive in Port Said and clear customs later in 2004. However, AidData has not identified any evidence of a shipment arrival.
justification: Project involves food aid and food security assistance, which does not have direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Provision of beans as food aid, focus on developmental assistance and food security

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 85 million interest-free loan for 55.6 km Bata-Niefang Road Reconstruction and Expansion Project
description: In 2001, the Chinese Government and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed an agreement on the 55.6 km Bata-Niefang Road Reconstruction and Expansion Project. Then, in 2003, the Chinese Government and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed an interest-free loan agreement for the 55.6 km Bata-Niefang Road Reconstruction and Expansion Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce reportedly committed RMB 85 million in total and drew the funds from two Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ECTAs) that the two governments signed in 1999 and 2002. The interest-free loan fully disbursed, and as of December 31, 2019, the borrower had not made any principal or interest repayments.   The project involved the laying of a second layer of asphalt on a 55.6 km road segment along National Highway No. 1 that begins in the city of Bata and ends in the town of Niefang. The project also sought to expand the width of the road from 7 to 11 meters, improve driving conditions around 20 sharp bends, and alter the design speed of the road from 60 km per hour to 55 km per hour.   China Wu Yi Co., Ltd. and China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC) were the contractors responsible for implementation. The project design phase commenced in May 2005 and ended in August 2005. Project implementation commenced in October 2011 and reached completion on August 13, 2013.
staff_comments: 1. The Spanish project title is Proyecto de Reparación de la Carretera Bata Niefang (del km 3 al km 31). The Chinese project title is 巴塔至涅方公路改扩建项目 or 巴塔-涅方公路项目 or 巴塔-涅方公路 or 中国援赤道几内亚巴塔至涅方公路修复项目 or 赤道几内亚——涅方-恩圭公路 or 巴塔至涅方公路改扩建项目. 2. In the database of Chinese loan commitments that it released in July 2020, SAIS-CARI identifies this project as reaching the loan signature (i.e. official commitment) stage but not the implementation stage or completion stage. AidData identifies this project as a fully completed project since multiple sources (including China’s Ministry of Commerce and CRBC) identify 2013 as the year in which this project was completed. 3. Since the borrowing terms for the interest-free loan are unavailable, AidData has set maturity period to 20 years by default and grace period to 10 years by default per China's Foreign Assistance White Paper (http://www.cidca.gov.cn/2018-08/06/c_129925064_3.htm) which states that the maturity period of interest-free loans is 20 years, with a drawdown period of 5 years, grace period of 5 years, and repayment over 10 years. AidData treats the drawdown period as providing 5 years of additional grace. 4. The proceeds of the loan may have been drawn from one or more of the Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ECTAs) and interest-free loan agreements that were signed by the Chinese Government and the Government of Equatorial Guinea on December 17, 1999, December 12, 2000, November 19, 2001, and October 21, 2002. Only the face values of these two interest-free loan agreements are known. According to the Autonomous Fund for Amortization of Public Debt (Caja Autónoma de Amortización de la Deuda Pública) within Equatorial Guinea’s Ministry of Finance and Budget, the RMB 20,000,000 loan that was contracted on December 17, 1999 and the RMB 11,500,000 loan that was contracted on October 21, 2002 had fully disbursed as of December 31, 2019. The borrower never made any principal or interest repayments on either loan. 5. China’s Ministry of Commerce funded the construction of this road between 1995 and 1999 at a cost of RMB 163 million. 6. It is unclear if the RMB 20,000,000 loan that was contracted on December 17, 1999 supported the construction of the Bata-Niefang Road or the reconstruction and expansion of the Bata-Niefang Road. This issue warrants further investigation.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 85 million interest-free loan for 55.6 km Bata-Niefang Road Reconstruction and Expansion Project

# Description
In 2001, the Chinese Government and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed an agreement on the 55.6 km Bata-Niefang Road Reconstruction and Expansion Project. Then, in 2003, the Chinese Government and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed an interest-free loan agreement for the 55.6 km Bata-Niefang Road Reconstruction and Expansion Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce reportedly committed RMB 85 million in total and drew the funds from two Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ECTAs) that the two governments signed in 1999 and 2002. The interest-free loan fully disbursed, and as of December 31, 2019, the borrower had not made any principal or interest repayments.   The project involved the laying of a second layer of asphalt on a 55.6 km road segment along National Highway No. 1 that begins in the city of Bata and ends in the town of Niefang. The project also sought to expand the width of the road from 7 to 11 meters, improve driving conditions around 20 sharp bends, and alter the design speed of the road from 60 km per hour to 55 km per hour.   China Wu Yi Co., Ltd. and China Road & Bridge Corporation (CRBC) were the contractors responsible for implementation. The project design phase commenced in May 2005 and ended in August 2005. Project implementation commenced in October 2011 and reached completion on August 13, 2013.
justification: Road reconstruction and expansion project with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: 55.6 km road segment reconstruction, asphalt laying, road width expansion, driving condition improvements

title: Chinese Government dispatches 22nd medical team to Bata General Hospital and Malabo Regional Hospital
description: On October 18, 2003, the Chinese Government and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 22nd Chinese medical team to Equatorial Guinea. The 21-member team was stationed at the Bata General Hospital in the city of Bata and Malabo Regional Hospital in the city of Malabo. 11 team members were stationed in Malabo and 10 in Bata. The team arrived in Equatorial Guinea in June 24, 2004 and competed its term of service in mid-2006. It was presented with various awards by the Equatorial Guinean government on July 6, 2006.  Guangzhou Health Department has been sending medical teams to Equatorial Guinea since 1971.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 22nd medical team to Bata General Hospital and Malabo Regional Hospital

# Description
On October 18, 2003, the Chinese Government and the Government of Equatorial Guinea signed a protocol agreement, dispatching the 22nd Chinese medical team to Equatorial Guinea. The 21-member team was stationed at the Bata General Hospital in the city of Bata and Malabo Regional Hospital in the city of Malabo. 11 team members were stationed in Malabo and 10 in Bata. The team arrived in Equatorial Guinea in June 24, 2004 and competed its term of service in mid-2006. It was presented with various awards by the Equatorial Guinean government on July 6, 2006.  Guangzhou Health Department has been sending medical teams to Equatorial Guinea since 1971.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Medical team deployment to hospitals, healthcare focus

title: China provides a 2,000 tonne of donation of Maize to Eritrea
description: On March  28, 2003,  Eritrea received a 2,000 metric ton donation of maize from the Chinese government to combat the drought. The Chinese ambassador to Eritrea passed the donation to the director of macro policy and international cooperation, Dr. Woldai Fitur. The head of the Grain Board, Ms. Hiwot Zemikael, also attended the handing over ceremony. Also see ID# 1413
combined_text:
# Sector

The Chinese ambassador to Eritrea passed the donation to the director of macro policy and international cooperation, Dr. Woldai Fitur. The head of the Grain Board, Ms. Hiwot Zemikael, also attended the handing over ceremony. Also see ID# 1413
